issue.title: Help needed upgrading HoloNET (c# and unity) Client to Beta v0.1.5

comment.body:
> The issue we now have is that it doesn't seem to start the appagent connection on 8888 anymore? If I try to add that it gives me an error:
> 
> ```
> C:\Users\USER\holochain-holochain-0.1.5\happs\oasis>PowerShell -Command "'' | hc s --piped -f=65000 run=8888"
> ```

You're using `run` as a flag here, but you don't pass in a subcommand. So `run=8888` is interpreted as a subcommand. If you already have a sandbox conductor created, the command is
```sh
$ hc s -f=65000 run -p=8888
```

Otherwise it's
```sh
$ hc s generate workdir/your.happ --run=8888
```

issue.title: Help needed upgrading HoloNET (c# and unity) Client to Beta v0.1.5

comment.body:
> Yes I was going to ask about that too, in your example code you need to call the "attach_app_interface" API call before you then open a appagent web socket to the port returned from the api call. So this leads me to believe you need to have a separate connection for each app?

Correct

> So how could one connection be shared with numerous apps?

You wouldn't. That is part of the idea, to have one connection per app per agent. We're in the process of [discussing](https://github.com/holochain/holochain/discussions/2960) a fixed binding of an app websocket to a specific app. It's not only a pragmatic decision but also a security concern if an agent can make calls to other apps through the same connection.

issue.title: Help needed upgrading HoloNET (c# and unity) Client to Beta v0.1.5

comment.body:
@dellams - in rust, we have the [rmpv](https://docs.rs/rmpv/latest/rmpv/) crate which lets us deserialize arbitrary message pack into dynamic self-describing structures. Is there something like that in the message pack library you are using?

It might be beneficial for debugging if you could deserialize into something dynamic like that, and then print it out as part of the error message whenever there is a deserialization error into one of your more static structures to help diagnose the mis-match.

issue.title: Help needed upgrading HoloNET (c# and unity) Client to Beta v0.1.5
